<color=orange>Excavation Site</color>
1
OENO: Yarrow and I noticed the rotating doors on several towers on Ash Twin opening and closing on their own, even in the absence of any Nomai.
2
1
OENO: After closer study, I can confidently conclude that this phenomenon is not caused by any structural defect in the doors, but by the sunless day.
3 2
OENO: As the <color=lightblue>Hourglass Twins</color> orbit around each other, they become aligned along a straight line with the sun at regular intervals, causing a sunless day on the twin farther from the sun.
4
3
OENO: The twin farther from the sun feels not only gravity from the sun, but also gravity from the twin closer to the sun pulling in the same direction.
5
4
OENO: These combined gravitational forces cause an extraordinarily strong pull of gravity that pulls on anything in its path, including the vision orbs powering the doors.
6
5
OENO: It is this same force that causes sand to be pulled towards the other twin at the alignment point, creating the striking funnel of sand between the <color=lightblue>Hourglass Twins.</color>
7
6
YARROW: What an enlightening report, Oeno! Now that we know the issue, we will know how to amend it in the future. You have my gratitude for your hard work.
8
2
OENO: Though the <color=lightblue>Hourglass Twins</color> feel a constant pull of gravity from each other, this force alone should not be enough to cause vision orbs to activate.
